Package main

Class Monster

java.lang.Object
main.Monster
All Implemented Interfaces:
Purchasable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AverageJoe, Chunky, Lanky, Raka, Shanny, Zap
public abstract class Monster extends Object implements Purchasable
An abstract class that describes a monster.
Author:
Farzad and Daniel

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Monster(String name, String description, int maxHealth, int damage, int cost, int level, int healAmount, double critRate)

  • Constructor Details

    • Monster

      public Monster(String name, String description, int maxHealth, int damage, int cost, int level, int healAmount, double critRate)
      Creates a new Monster object Sets the monster's name, description, maxHealth, damage, cost, level, healAmount and critRate with the given values Sets the monster's initial health to the maxHealth Sets the monster's maximum level based on the difficulty of the GameEnvironment object
      Parameters:
      name - given String for the monster's name
      description - given String for the monster's description
      maxHealth - given int for the monster's maximum health
      damage - given int for the monster's damage
      cost - given int for the monster's cost
      level - given int for the monster's current level
      healAmount - given int for the monster's heal amount overnight
      critRate - given double for the monster's critical rate

      Parameters:
      name - the new value of name
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - if the name is not valid

    • heal

      public void heal()
      If monster is fainted, set the new value of isFainted to false Increase the monster health by the healAmount value

    • heal

      public void heal(int amount) throws InvalidValueException
      If monster is fainted, set the new value of isFainted to false Increase the monster health by the amount value
      Parameters:
      amount - the heal amount
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - if given amount value is 0 or negative

    • attack

      public int attack(Monster other) throws InvalidValueException, InvalidTargetException
      Deal damage to the given Monster object Damage to deal is calulated in finalDamage method
      Parameters:
      other - given Monster object
      Returns:
      damageDealt the final damage dealt to the given Monster object
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - if given Monster object is fainted
      InvalidTargetException - if the target is fainted

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int damageReceived) throws InvalidValueException
      Reduce monster's health based on given value
      Parameters:
      damageReceived - given int value to reduce from monster's health
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - if given value is less than 0

    • finalDamage

      public int finalDamage()
      Calculate totalDamage to deal based on the critical rate and critical multiplier
      Returns:
      the totalDamage after taking into account the critical rate

    • buy

      public String buy() throws InsufficientFundsException, InvalidValueException, InventoryFullException
      Buy a monster from the shop and add it to the player inventory.
      Returns:
      the string representing what the player bought
      Throws:
      InsufficientFundsException - if cost of monster is more than player balance
      InvalidValueException - if value of balance to minus is invalid
      InventoryFullException - if the player monster inventory is full

    • sell

      public String sell() throws InvalidValueException
      Sell monster back to the shop for a partial refund and removes the monster from the player's inventory
      Returns:
      the string representing what the player sold
      Throws:
      InvalidValueException - if value of balance to add is invalid

    • levelUp

      public void levelUp() throws StatMaxedOutException
      Level up the monster by 1 level
      Throws:
      StatMaxedOutException - if monster's level value is the same as maxLevel value

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the string representation of the Monster object

    • view

      public String view()
      Returns:
      result the string representation of the Monster object followed by command line options
